In a vibrant forest, a cunning fox named Felix was known for his beautiful, bushy tail. One day, while boasting to the other animals, he encountered a sly wolf who challenged him to a race. Confident, Felix accepted, but as he sprinted, he stumbled into a trap set by hunters. The trap stripped him of his prized tail. Ashamed, he hid from the other animals, but soon realized that true cunning lay not in appearance but in wit. He used his cleverness to outsmart the hunters and protect his friends, proving that even without a tail, he could still be a hero.
